C D E G H I M N P S T U V 

D

data - Variable in class Game
Variable of type Statistics for analysis of the performance of the player in the game.
Debug - Class in PokerProject
Class Debug extends Class Game and it represents the Debug Mode of playing Video Poker.
Debug(int, String, String, Variants) - Constructor for class Debug
Constructor specifying the initial balance of the player, the name of two files and the Variants of Video Poker being used.
Deck - Class in PokerProject
Class Deck represents 52 different cards (as in a real deck).
Deck() - Constructor for class Deck
Constructor which creates an initially empty array of cards, then adds the 52 different cards and finally shuffles the array.
Deck(char[]) - Constructor for class Deck
Constructor specifying the cards to add to the deck.
deck - Variable in class Game
Variable of type Deck that corresponds to the deck of cards used for playing.
deckSize() - Method in class Deck
Gets the size of the array of cards.
doAdvice() - Method in class Game
When asked for advice of what cards to hold (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the suggestion of the indexes is printed in the terminal.
doAdvice() - Method in interface VideoPoker
When asked for advice about what cards to hold.
doBet() - Method in class Game
When asked for betting during the game (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the value of the bet is printed in the terminal.
doBet() - Method in interface VideoPoker
When asked for bet a specific amount of money.
doCredit() - Method in class Game
When asked for the credit of the player (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the user credit's is printed in the terminal.
doCredit() - Method in interface VideoPoker
When asked for the credit of the player.
doDeal() - Method in class Debug
When asked for dealing the cards (in Debug Mode) a message with the first hand is printed in the terminal.
doDeal() - Method in class Interactive
When asked for dealing the cards (in Interactive Mode) a message with the first hand is printed in the terminal.
doDeal() - Method in class Simulation
Dealing the cards (in Simulation Mode) means that five cards from the deck are assigned as the user's first hand and that the bet value is decremented from the player's credit.
doEvaluation() - Method in class Game
After holding cards, the evaluation of the final hand is done and (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message saying if the player won or lost is printed in the terminal.
doEvaluation() - Method in class Simulation
The evaluation of the final hand (in Simulation Mode) consists of checking the result (win or lost), incrementing the number of deals (in the statistics), incrementing the incNbHands accordingly and incrementing the credits won in case of winning hand.
doEvaluation() - Method in interface VideoPoker
When asked for the evaluation of the final hand of the player.
doHold() - Method in class Game
When asked for the holding cards (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a message with the final hand is printed in the terminal, as well as the evaluation of the final hand (if the player won or lost).
doHold() - Method in class Simulation
Holding cards (in Simulation Mode) means that the perfect strategy is used as the choice for which cards to hold.
doHold() - Method in interface VideoPoker
When asked for hold specific cards.
doStatistics() - Method in class Game
When asked for the statistics of the game (in Interactive Mode and in Debug) a table with statistics is printed in the terminal.
doStatistics() - Method in class Simulation
The statistics (in Simulation Mode) are asked only at the end of the game, and then a table with the statistics is printed in the terminal.
doStatistics() - Method in interface VideoPoker
When asked for the statistics of the player since the beginning of the game.
DoubleBonus - Class in Variants
Class DoubleBonus implements the Class Variants and it represents the Double Bonus 10/7 variant of Video Poker.
DoubleBonus() - Constructor for class DoubleBonus
 
draw() - Method in class Deck
Gets the first card from the deck, returns it and removes it from the deck since it can't be drawn again.
